skill.name: reasoning-counterfactual
skill.description: Evaluate alternative scenarios by simulating interventions on past decisions or hypothetical futures. Use when assessing decisions in hindsight, planning scenarios, or comparing paths not taken. Produces comparative analysis with probability-weighted outcomes.
skill.summary: Evaluate alternative scenarios by simulating interventions on past decisions or hypothetical futures...
skill.author: BellaBe

security_audit.summary: This is a pure markdown documentation skill with no executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. It defines a structured reasoning framework using YAML schemas and documentation only.

content.user_title: Evaluate past decisions with what-if analysis
content.value_statement: Making important decisions without understanding alternatives leads to missed opportunities and repeated mistakes. This skill provides a structured four-stage framework to simulate alternative scenarios, weight outcomes by probability, and extract actionable insights from decisions made or considered.
actual_capabilities: Documents actual decisions with outcomes, metrics, and causal chains
Defines minimal interventions to test specific hypotheses
Projects alternative outcomes with probability-weighted scenarios
Compares actual vs alternative results with quantitative analysis
Extracts actionable insights and recommendations from comparisons
limitations: Does not execute decisions or make changes to systems
Cannot access real-time data or external databases
Does not integrate with third-party APIs or services
Relies on user-provided context and historical data

use_cases.title: Evaluate strategic choices
use_cases.description: Compare actual business decisions against alternatives to learn what worked and what could improve future outcomes.

use_cases.title: Assess feature prioritization
use_cases.description: Analyze whether choosing different features or approaches would have led to better product outcomes.

use_cases.title: Review funding decisions
use_cases.description: Examine past investment choices or funding decisions to understand trade-offs between growth, dilution, and risk.

prompt_templates.title: Basic decision review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use counterfactual reasoning to evaluate this decision: [describe the decision, what happened, and an alternative you considered at the time]. Provide the four-stage analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Scenario comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare these two options [Option A vs Option B] using counterfactual analysis. Document the actual choice, project outcomes for the alternative, and extract actionable insights.

prompt_templates.title: With probability weighting
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this decision [describe decision and outcome] using counterfactual reasoning. Include multiple scenarios with probability weights and confidence intervals.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-intervention analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate multiple interventions for this decision [describe context]. Run counterfactual analysis on each alternative, create a comparison matrix, and recommend the best path forward.

output_examples.input: Should we have lowered our enterprise price from $50K to $30K last year? We priced at $50K and closed 3 deals in 6 months for $150K ARR.
output: ACTUAL: Priced enterprise tier at $50K, closed 3 deals ($150K ARR), 120-day sales cycle
INTERVENTION: Test $30K price point with same product and market conditions
ALTERNATIVE SCENARIOS: Expected 6 deals (60%), Optimistic 8 deals (25%), Pessimistic 4 deals (15%) â†’ Weighted: 6 deals, $178K ARR, 74-day cycle
COMPARISON: Better deals (+3), higher ARR (+$28K), faster cycle (-46 days), but lower margin per deal (-41%)
VERDICT: Alternative likely better for velocity at this stage, but creates different long-term customer dynamics
INSIGHT: At this stage, velocity matters more than margin for early enterprise sales
RECOMMENDATION: Consider price reduction or tier restructuring to improve sales velocity

best_practices: Use minimal interventions that change only one variable at a time to isolate cause and effect
Assign probabilities to alternative scenarios and ensure they sum to 1.0 for validity
Explicitly state confidence levels and key uncertainties to avoid overconfidence in projections
anti_patterns: Using hindsight bias to make alternatives seem more obvious than they were at decision time
Considering only one scenario without probability weights or best/worst case analysis
Evaluating interventions that were not actually available or controllable at the time

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It is a prompt-based reasoning framework.

faq.question: What decisions work best for counterfactual analysis?
faq.answer: High-stakes decisions with clear outcomes and alternatives that were actually considered at the time work best.

faq.question: How is this different from causal reasoning?
faq.answer: Causal reasoning explains why something happened. Counterfactual reasoning asks what would have happened if something had been different.

faq.question: Does this skill access my data?
faq.answer: No. This is a pure reasoning framework. It only processes context you provide in your prompts.

faq.question: What if I cannot assign probabilities to scenarios?
faq.answer: Use qualitative confidence levels (high/medium/low) and explicitly acknowledge uncertainty. Multiple scenarios still provide value even without precise probabilities.

faq.question: When should I not use this skill?
faq.answer: Avoid for executing known processes, explaining observations (use abductive), or resolving disagreements (use dialectical).
